column2: This addin is part of JuliaExcel. For more information visit:
The password to view the VBA code is JuliaExcel

column6: Double-click to filter
Comment
column8: Amend method PostMessageToJulia to clear the REPL via Ctrl+E, Ctrl+U.

column6: Bug fix to Unserialise.
Added method ReThrow for use in error handlers.
DateTime now transported Julia->Excel using hex representation.
Single/Float32 are now transported between Excel and Julia as the 8-character uppercase hexadecimal string representing the IEEE-754 bit pattern of the Single/Float32. Avoids loss of precision.
Double/Float64 are now transported between Excel and Julia as the 16-character uppercase hexadecimal string representing the IEEE-754 bit pattern of the Double/Float64. Avoids loss of precision.
Code comments only

Improves file and folder handling in modUtils.bas, including a more robust SaveTextFile with retry logic, a new GetFullTempPath function to avoid 8.3 username issues, and refactors LocalTemp to use these improvements.
Method SpeedTest2 method for benchmarking JuliaEval performance with simple expressions.
Method MakeJuliaLiteral now has special handling for nine characters in order to avoid an error on the Julia side: Base.Meta.ParseError("unbalanced bidirectional formatting in string literal")
Windows API functions GetCurrentProcessID and IsWindow now declared Private so no longer visible from Excel.
Code comments only.
Launch Julia with -i command line option. Plays nice with OhMyREPL.
Tweak to method JuliaExcelLocation to search in additional locations.
Fixed bug in JuliaEvalVBA - bug was introduced by previous change and made JuliaEvalVBA fail whenever returning strings.
Improved handling of string length limits.
JuliaLaunch now checks for existence of wsl.exe
Amended method GetStringLengthLimit. Now returns 256 on Excel 2013.
No longer test from VBA code if Julia executable is available within WSL.
No longer assume Revise is available as a package.

Non-backwards compatible changes to JuliaLaunch. Can no longer specify the location of the JuliaExecutable (seemed not useful in practice, can always edit the PATH) and can specify packages to load. Turns out that packages should be "used" (via `using PackageName`) before the call to `using JuliaExcel`. That (seems to, fingers crossed) avoid "world age" problems that can be encountered when using Julia's eval function. We want to avoid defining the functions of JuliaEval (notably `encode_for_xl`) before we define the types it may operate on.
Added exportStatements as arg to JuliaLaunch.
Updated docstrings.
Deleted unused code.
Added UseLinux argument to JuliaLaunch.
Made public functions explicitly Public.
Documented method JuliaIsRunning.
Added method JuliaIsRunning.
Re-ordered methods in modMain.
Documentation only.
Changes to code to register functions with intellisense.
Made functions JuliaFlagFile and JuliaExpressionFile be Private.
Improved docstrings.
Changed return from LocalTemp so that files are now saved at C:\Users\<UserName>\AppData\Local\Temp\@JuliaExcel\
Fix to JuliaUnserialiseFile.
Added functions JuliaExpressionFile, JuliaFlagFile, JuliaResultFile, JuliaUnserialiseFile.
Method Serialise (not currently used, but would be useful for tests) now handles input x of type Dictionary.
JuliaEvalVBA and JuliaCallVBA can now return arrays of dictionaries, dictionaries of arrays etc. etc.
JuliaEvalVBA and JuliaCallVBA can now return AbstractDictionary as Scripting.Dictionary.
Updated documentation.
Added optional argument CommandLineOptions to function JuliaLaunch.
When launching Julia now set command-line option --threads=auto
JuliaEvalFromVBA --> JuliaEvalVBA, JuliaCallFromVBA --> JuliaCallVBA

Ditched function JuliaCall2 and arguments PrecedentCell. While I can make it work for JuliaSetVar and JuliaInclude, I don't think it's possible to make it work for JuliaCall and JuliaEval (though perhaps not necessary in those cases). Useful resource: https://www.decisionmodels.com/calcsecretsj.htm
Edited docstrings.
Test for Function Wizard active. Exit early if so.
No longer register functions on add-in open. I think it's not necessary.
Changes in module RegisterAll.
Updated "docstrings".
Updated _Intellisense_ sheet.
Re-wrote code to register functions with the Excel function wizard.
Updated _Intellisense_ sheet.
Planning reform to handling of vectors.
Change names of the Flag, Request and Result files.
Changed method PostMessageToJulia to make Julia exit Package mode if it's in it.
Added worksheet _IntelliSense_ Plan is to hook into Excel.DNA intellisense.
JuliaLaunch was not registered, fixed.
Reform to handling of 1-dimensional arrays. Added new function JuliaCall3
Change to RegisterAll - avoid "Do you want to save?" dialog when exiting Excel.
VBA now password protected to prevent accidental changes. The password will be public and is JuliaExcel.
ThrowIfError now Public.
Added link to github
Refactoring.
Workbook_Open changes.
Improved other error messages.
Improved error messages from JuliaEval.
Fixes to function registration, take 2.
Fixes to function registration.
Nested arrays now handled, though they cannot be returned to a worksheet.
Code comments
Handle strings > 32767 (by throwing error if being called from Excel worksheet).
Bug fix to JuliaCall2
JuliaVBA -> JuliaExcel
Named the VBA project.
Various bug fixes.
Rename JuliaInterop--> JuliaVBA
Refactoring.
Refactoring.
Int64 values from Julia now handled differently on 32bit and 64bit Excel.
Bashing on.
Speedup to method Decode, added code comments, hack change to method LocalTemp to remove 8.3 encoding of username.
Fixed compile errors on 32bit Excel.
Moved sheet Examples to a new workbook.
Better handling of results which are a) Functions, b) arrays containing arrays.
No longer use CSV file format, but my own custom serialization.
Last version prior to experimenting (on a branch) with a custom file format in place of CSV for communicating data back to Excel.
New location of VBA code in repo
Changed method DefaultJuliaExe to search first on path.
Planning name change VBAInterop to ExcelJuliaCall
Improved JuliaSetVar and added JuliaInclude
First naive version of JuliaSetVar.
Better error handling for when executing the startup file leads to an error.
Now have separate function JuliaLaunch.
Wait loop in JuliaEval now tests if Julia is still alive, by checking if the window handle is still valid. So can evaluate "exit()" without an infinite loop!
First version with no dependency on SolumAddin.
Minor tweaks
Will no longer be cross-talk if we run two instance of Excel. Each Excel will talk to a dedicated Julia process.
No longer send commands to Julia via SendKeys but use WindowsAPI SendMessage instead.

First working version:
We have two functions JuliaCall and JuliaEval.
Added experimental code from when I was trying to make VBAInterop work "properly" using sockets. I have given up on that approach, at least for now.
Added Audit sheet
